name: LSD
description: This class represents various deformities of the lumbar spine, including conditions such as scoliosis, kyphosis, and lordosis. Detecting these deformities is crucial for diagnosis, treatment planning, and monitoring changes over time.

features.description: Angles between vertebrae and curvature measurements to assess the degree of deformity.
Use of 3D models to visualize the shape and alignment of lumbar vertebrae.
Identification of anomalies in vertebral shapes or alignment using imaging techniques.

name: OSF
description: This class pertains to the presence of osteophytes (bone spurs) that develop along the edges of lumbar vertebrae, often resulting from joint degeneration or inflammation. Identifying osteophyte formation is important for diagnosing osteoarthritis and related conditions.

features.description: Detecting bone spurs using imaging modalities like X-rays, MRI, or CT scans.
Analyzing the texture around vertebrae for changes indicative of osteophyte presence.
Measuring the size of osteophytes and their relative location to other spinal structures.

name: SPIDER
description: This class identifies a specific spinal condition characterized by certain features, potentially based on its shape or appearance in imaging. Accurate detection of this pathology allows for targeted interventions.

features.description: Identifying characteristic patterns in images that correspond to the specific spinal condition.
Isolating the pathology from surrounding tissues for detailed analysis.
Linking imaging findings to clinical symptoms experienced by patients.

name: TSEG
description: This class refers to the transition area between the thoracic and lumbar spine, an important region that experiences significant stress and injury. Assessing the thoracolumbar segment is essential for understanding spinal stability and mobility.

features.description: Evaluating the alignment and integrity of vertebrae in the thoracolumbar segment.
Analyzing motion in this segment using dynamic imaging techniques.
Identifying degenerative changes or injuries within the thoracolumbar segment.
